page.title: 06INTERESTING BUILDINGS CONT.
page.content: {ST. JOHN'S CHURCH.__}Rebuilt on the original site in 1874 with a kneeler from the previous church inscribed FI1801 in the south wall. The architect and builder was J.Jones of Leyburn.A dignified little church with an attractive bell turret, seats and fittings of pitch pine, a font of local stone and an old desk from the school in the vestry. The graveyard, though not ancient, has interesting stones recalling the old village families, the Boer War, former vicars, centenarians and local gravestone cutters. {THE MEMORIAL HALL__ }This was built in 1930 to commemorate those who lost their lives in the war. It is now the centre of community life in the village. The playing field nearby has vestiges of medieval cultivation strips.
